alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 11 at 3:44AM MDT until April 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY EASTWARD BELOW ANY SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40 AND EAST OF I-25... .Warm, dry, windy, and unstable conditions will persist areawide today. Very strong to potentially damaging wind gusts to around 65 or 70 mph are possible Tuesday along and east of the central mountain chain as well as over portions of northwest and west central NM. Critical fire weather conditions are expected to develop Tuesday along and east of the Middle Rio Grande Valley. While temperatures will be cooler than normal Wednesday, extremely dry conditions with widespread and long duration single digit humidities will be combined with windy weather. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 10 AM to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains below any snowpack, Northeast and East Central Plains, Middle Rio Grande Valley. Critical conditions are expected to develop by midday today and persist through mid evening. Stronger and possibly damaging winds are possible Tuesday with critical conditions expected along and east of the Middle Rio Grande Valley from midmorning through midevening Tuesday. Critical conditions redevelop Wednesday morning and continue through the evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to around 50 mph this afternoon. Southwest to west 30 to 45 mph with gusts to 65 mph Tuesday. Northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph Wednesday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from around 9 to 13 percent this afternoon, 10 to 15 percent Tuesday and 4 to 8 percent Wednesday. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains
